intro: Iris sanguinea var. violacea, commonly known as the purple flag iris, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It features tall, slender stems that bear showy, violet-blue flowers with a distinctive white throat. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves that are typically blue-green in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
